alert.note: Alert for Chatham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 17 at 8:05AM EDT until March 18 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Deep River At Moncure affecting Chatham and Lee Counties. Haw River Near Bynum affecting Chatham County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Haw River Near Bynum. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Mindor flooding begins. The river widens up to 400 feet across. It floods pasturelands on the right bank and woodlands on the left. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:46 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Haw River Bynum 11.0 11.1 Thu 7 am EDT 8.7 6.8 6.0 5.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening by 815 PM EDT.
